meanings.sent1: The alley behind the restaurant was the grubbiest place I had ever seen.
meanings.sent2: After playing in the mud, the children were the grubbiest they had ever been.
meanings.sent3: Despite his best efforts, he always ended up looking like the grubbiest player on the field.
meanings.sent4: The old abandoned house looked like the grubbiest memory from a forgotten time.
meanings.sent5: The dog rolled around in the mud, becoming the grubbiest creature in the park.

meanings.sent1: The grubbiest teddy bear had missing buttons and torn seams.
meanings.sent2: She wore the grubbiest dress to the costume party, hoping to win the prize for the most authentic look.
meanings.sent3: The car sputtered to a stop, its engine sounding like the grubbiest old machine in town.
meanings.sent4: The once vibrant painting now appeared as the grubbiest relic of a forgotten era.
meanings.sent5: His shoes, the grubbiest pair in the closet, had seen many miles of adventures.

meanings.definition: In a poor or disreputable condition
meanings.sent1: The grubbiest motel in town had flickering neon lights and peeling paint.
meanings.sent2: Living in the grubbiest part of the city, she dreamed of a better life.
meanings.sent3: The cat strutted around like the grubbiest aristocrat in the alley.
meanings.sent4: The town's reputation as the grubbiest in the region was hard to shake.
meanings.sent5: The restaurant's restroom was the grubbiest corner of an otherwise elegant establishment.
